alert.note: Alert for Caddo; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 21 at 11:46AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Garvin, Grady, Seminole, eastern Caddo, Cleveland, northwestern Pontotoc, Pottawatomie and McClain Counties through 1215 PM CDT... At 1143 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking the leading edge of winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Prague to 5 miles west of Tecumseh to 4 miles southeast of Newcastle to 3 miles northeast of Pocasset to near Binger. Movement was south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Surface observation stations recorded wind gusts of 53 mph at Will Rogers Airport, and 48 mph in El Reno. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Norman, Shawnee, Chickasha, Newcastle, Blanchard, Seminole, Anadarko, Tecumseh, Purcell, Noble, Slaughterville, Wewoka, Lindsay, Lexington, Pink, Goldsby, Minco, Apache, Konawa, and Maysville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 79 and 113. Interstate 40 between mile markers 187 and 209. Interstate 44 between mile markers 65 and 106. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Caddo; Cleveland; Garvin; Grady; McClain; Pontotoc; Pottawatomie; Seminole
